newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Hariri in Morocco to discuss stalled Mideast peace.
newsitem.headline: Hariri in Morocco to discuss stalled Mideast peace.

text.p: Lebanon's Prime Minister Rafik al-Hariri arrived in Morocco on Tuesday to discuss the deadlocked Middle East peace process with King Hassan.

"Talks with King Hassan will include bilateral cooperation as well as problems facing the Middle East peace process as a result of the Israeli government's intransigence," Hariri told reporters on arrival.
Starting a three-day visit to Morocco, Hariri heads a team of economic, finance, industry and information ministers, Morocco's official news agency MAP said.

Prime Minister Abdellatif Filali who met him at the airport said Morocco was committed to U.N Security Council resolution 425 which stipulates that Israel should withdraw from the strip of land it occupies in south Lebanon.
Hariri last visited Morocco in April last year when he was touring Arab countries asking for support following the Israeli "Operation Grapes of Wrath" artillery and air attacks on southern Lebanon.
